Reviews.Title: Excellent smartphone with tons of applications
Reviews.Author: pedrovay2003
Reviews.Content: When I set out to buy my first smartphone, I wanted one that supported a lot of applications -- That's why you buy a phone that does more than make calls, after all.  I picked the Dash because it runs the same operating system as Pocket PCs, which have been around for years.  This means the Dash can run all of the programs that were made for Pocket PCs, allowing you to choose from thousands of games, office apps, music players, video players, and tons more.The phone is quite easy to use, and the keyboard feels great.  Overall, I've been extremely happy with the Dash, and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good smartphone for a low price.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: Ro
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because it is the only phone T-Mobile carries that is compatible with Mobilespeak, a screenreader for cell phones. I went blind a year ago, and did not have an accessible phone. After installing Mobilespeak, the Dash became fully accessible. I can now text again, though on the full keyboard, its taken some getting used to doing it blind. The 5 key is the D key, so there is a raised bump there which helps me find my place. I have the sounds all routed through my blue tooth, even the screenreader, so I have privacy for texting and so the computerized voice does not annoy people. I get baseball text alerts too. The sound quality is excellent, and all my calls are crystal clear.The design is slim which is comfortable for holding, but doesn't work so well if the need arises to prop the phone on my shoulder. There is a touch strip on the side  of the screen to adjust volume during calls, but I prefer the old buttons on the side of the phone to do this.The internet works well and is fairly fast. I don't know if it is the screenreader, or the fact that it is a Windows phone, but it tends to freeze if I go too fast. Popping the battery out resets it, and this is easy to do even though I can'tsee.The windows on the phone open and close like a Windows computer and they are easily navigated.All in all, I like it, but mostly because of the screenreader I have installed. I do like the audio quality though; it is better than my old Samsung flip phone.

Reviews.Title: Best smartphone I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Jessica D. Rocha "Jessica Rocha"
Reviews.Content: I love this phone, its been my favorite out of many. And I have had lots. The phone is very durable, I have dropped it plently on times and it still works. The screen is glass and it had never broken. The buttons are amazing. Makes texting so much easier. Its kind of like a keyboard. You can type without looking. Its very small and thin.Cons: It can freeze up if you have too many programs open. The programs dont close on their own. If you just close it, its most like minimizing the screen. Once a day I clear of the programs open to avoid this issue. You just go to the task manager and close all functions.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone But!
Reviews.Author: Wassamon420
Reviews.Content: The phone came is great condition dont get me wrong i love the phone even those its 2010 and this is a little bit older phone but hey i use prepaid so this is like getting a new iphone for me..Well the only thing i had to say that was really bad was the shipping..I came home one day tired hoping one ill get my phone. I looked in my mail box and the package was cramded into the mail box with the rest of my mail very horrible.. but other then that it is all good..Great phone and cheap.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I purchased my phone two years ago and love it.  I love the calendar feature and the full keyboard.  A couple of months ago I dropped it and the LCD screen cracked! (I have a snap on cover but it was not on at the time) I didn't want another phone, I wanted my phone!  So instead of paying for a new phone, I ordered a brand new LCD screen with the tools and I replaced it myself! I spent about $37.00 for the new screen vs.$200 to $300 plus for a new phone!  That is how much I love mine. Incidentally, I just ordered two new snap on covers....as I just dropped it again yesterday...with the cover ON and all was fine!! I highly recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Worst "Smart"Phone Ever Created
Reviews.Author: K. Barker
Reviews.Content: After the untimely death of my Blackberry (by toilet), I switched over to the Dash. This phone is the worst phone that has ever been put on the market. It is so awful that I am willingly switching over to a Nokia brick phone.Battery life: I am a college student and I have a 2 hour break between one of my classes. I pass the time by grabbing something to eat and looking up the news on my Dash. After a solid 10hr charge time (got to sleep in that day!) The phone died from using it in those two hours -- precisely, I sat down to eat at 1:27pm, it died at 2:43. That's just over an hour of internet usage. Fully charged. And this was not the first time.Volume controls: you have to press a side button that's more like a "slide" than a button. Problem is, the only time you can change the volume of your phone calls is in that phone call, so if you are scrambling to answer the phone, you may have "slid" your finger over the button and now you won't be able to hear your calls. Alternatively, you may not be able to hear at and and frantically slide your finger over the volume up button. The only time I've switched the volume is by accident.Alarm glitch: I put an alarm on my phone and shut it off for the evening. Unlike a Blackberry, Dash does not produce an alarm UNLESS IT IS ON. I turned on my phone fifteen minutes after my alarm was supposed to go off -- and that was three weeks ago. My phone TO THIS DAY has an alarm go off at 9:30am despite me disabling all the alarms. Tmobile store says they have no idea why that is after looking over my phone.Put your money somewhere else -- it isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: Really good phone
Reviews.Author: Lornapone
Reviews.Content: Bought this one a second time around as a family member had one from 2007 and it still works well.Really good phone,great camera, easy to use, wi fi ready, connects quickly to the net, reads PDF and other documents.

Reviews.Title: question
Reviews.Author: smtcmt258
Reviews.Content: can you use this phone without a SIM card? if not, you need to put this on the description that it requires a SIM card, i ordered this not knowing you need a SIM card. thanks for NOT telling me

Reviews.Title: Ok phone
Reviews.Author: Nika
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I bought this phone. I am with T-mobile and didn't have good reception with my old phone so I decided to get a new one. I read good reviews about good signal with this phone. It works OK, signal is better than my old phone had but sometimes it is not too clear sound at another side when you talk. Be aware that this phone comes with charger only (no accessories like USB cable, manual or headset). I downloaded Dash manual from the Internet and it says that a new phone comes with those 3 accessories so I called to Amazon help and was told that I can return the item for a full refund. Battery is OK but phone needs to be charged daily even if wi-fi/ the Internet off and you don't talk too much during a day.

Reviews.Title: A perfect little android
Reviews.Author: Ingrid Vargas "INGRIDDEVARGAS"
Reviews.Content: I bought this HTC almost one year ago, still working. I am travelling a lot and this one has everything that I need. Every different country  just have to change the sim card and that is all, it will keep working. Also it has wi-fi which is a plus with the price. The only thing that I miss sometime is an extra sd card to hear my music, but this is a basic cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Tashawn
Reviews.Content: I have an iPhone now.. But this used to be my favorite phone before I got it stolen.. Great for all purpose!!

Reviews.Title: about used dash phone
Reviews.Author: ronalt
Reviews.Content: originally i was expecting a flat phone but I got a more different battery , and a cover bigger so , the phone is working good . but not skinny as it is, and mr roman did not said anything about this modification, only used ,

Reviews.Title: Could Pull A Signal Out Of A Rock
Reviews.Author: Southeastern Mass Customer
Reviews.Content: Just tried 3 qwerty phones for my wife - Nokia e63, Blackberry 8820, and the Dash (HTC).We are in an extreme fringe area for reception with t-mobile and the dash was the only one able to get a great signal. This thing could pull a signal from a rock! Seriously great reception - the call quality was way above the others.Dash - I am not a real windows fan owning 3 macs, but the Dash is very straightforward. Great wifi, easy settings management, email and text is straight forward, and the keyboard is simple to use.Blackberry - Keys are not great and the reception was hit or miss.Nokia - The e63 had the best battery life and was pretty in red metallic, but the key functions and the settings were less than intuitive, and reception was hit or miss.I expected my wife to say she wanted to keep the e63 but she said give me the Dash!

Reviews.Title: Good, reliable phone
Reviews.Author: MisteReview
Reviews.Content: This is a reliable phone.  Has bluetooth, wifi, instant messaging, windows media player, and a list of other features.  Qwerty keypad allows for quick, precise texting.

Reviews.Title: WORST PHONE EVER. ZERO STARS.
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone ever made. You cannot hear anything unless you line up the slit in the handset to the exact center of your ear. The implementation of Windows Mobile is deplorable: you can't even locate contacts by typing the name; you have to dismiss reminders in order to log into the device...and if it gets stolen, the thief will see your calendar items. The volume control doesn't work at all. Because it isn't a touch screen you will be locked out of Outlook Notes. The screen is too small: you can only see one calendar item per day and it always displays the item that you don't want to see (if there are multiple items at the same time). HTC, in their state of denial, did not put a reset button on it, but it MUST be reset every few days or you will not get any emails.I could go on and on...AVOID THIS PHONE AT ALL COSTS!

ProductInfo.Features:
The smallest, slickest, smartest smartphone on the market today
Instantly rises to the head-of-the-class
Miniscule for a smartphone
It gives Motorola's Q phone a run for its money in size and function
Weighing in at 4.2 ounces, the Dash measures 4.4 by 2.5 by 0.5 inches
ProductInfo.Name: DASH HTC s620 s621 UNLOCKED WI-FI WORLD PHONE S 620
